subStages.name: Conduct Sprint Kick-off Meeting
content: Review sprint goal and backlog with the entire team
Clarify any questions about sprint items
Discuss team norms and expectations for the sprint
Energize the team and build enthusiasm for sprint goals

subStages.name: Set Up Sprint Environment
content: Ensure all necessary tools and resources are accessible
Set up or update the sprint board (physical or digital)
Verify that all team members have required access and permissions
Prepare sprint burndown or burnup chart

subStages.name: Assign Initial Tasks
content: Allow team members to self-select their first tasks
Ensure high-priority items are addressed early
Identify any tasks that can be worked on in parallel
Update sprint board with initial task assignments

subStages.name: Communicate Sprint Start
content: Notify stakeholders that the sprint has begun
Share sprint goal and high-level plan with relevant parties
Set expectations for sprint duration and any planned demos
Establish or reiterate communication channels for the sprint

subStages.name: Conduct Daily Stand-up Meetings
content: Hold brief (15-minute) daily meetings
Each team member shares: what they did yesterday, what they'll do today, and any blockers
Update sprint board based on progress reports
Identify and address any immediate issues or blockers

subStages.name: Work on Sprint Backlog Items
content: Team members work on their assigned tasks
Follow team's definition of done for each item
Collaborate and pair program when beneficial
Regularly update task status on sprint board

subStages.name: Manage Sprint Backlog
content: Keep sprint backlog up to date with current progress
Identify if any backlog items are at risk of not being completed
Communicate any significant changes or risks to Product Owner
Adjust sprint plan if necessary, in consultation with the team

subStages.name: Monitor Sprint Progress
content: Update sprint burndown or burnup chart daily
Track velocity and compare to previous sprints
Identify any trends or patterns in progress
Communicate progress to stakeholders as appropriate

subStages.name: Conduct Code Reviews
content: Perform peer code reviews for all completed work
Ensure adherence to coding standards and best practices
Provide constructive feedback to improve code quality
Address and resolve any issues identified during reviews

subStages.name: Perform Testing
content: Execute unit tests for new and modified code
Conduct integration testing as features are completed
Perform user acceptance testing for user stories
Document and track any bugs or issues found

subStages.name: Ensure Compliance with Definition of Done
content: Review each completed item against the Definition of Done
Verify that all acceptance criteria have been met
Ensure necessary documentation has been created or updated
Obtain necessary approvals before marking items as complete

subStages.name: Address Technical Debt
content: Identify any technical debt incurred during the sprint
Allocate time for refactoring and improving code quality
Update relevant documentation and comments
Plan for addressing any carried-over technical debt in future sprints

subStages.name: Provide Regular Updates
content: Share sprint progress with stakeholders at agreed intervals
Highlight key achievements and any significant challenges
Use visual aids (e.g., burndown charts) to illustrate progress
Address any questions or concerns from stakeholders

subStages.name: Manage Scope Changes
content: Identify any requested changes to sprint scope
Assess impact of changes on sprint goal and timeline
Communicate implications to Product Owner and stakeholders
Decide whether to incorporate changes or defer to future sprints

subStages.name: Prepare for Sprint Review
content: Schedule the sprint review meeting
Prepare demonstrations of completed work
Identify key stakeholders to invite
Compile sprint metrics and insights to share

subStages.name: Collect Continuous Feedback
content: Encourage ongoing feedback from team members
Note any process improvements or challenges identified
Collect user feedback on completed features when possible
Prepare to discuss feedback in sprint retrospective

subStages.name: Finalize Sprint Work
content: Complete all in-progress tasks if possible
Ensure all completed items meet Definition of Done
Identify any work that needs to be carried over to next sprint
Update sprint backlog and product backlog

subStages.name: Prepare Sprint Metrics
content: Calculate final sprint velocity
Compile sprint burndown or burnup chart
Gather any other relevant sprint metrics (e.g., bug count, test coverage)
Prepare summary of completed vs. planned work

subStages.name: Document Sprint Outcomes
content: Summarize key achievements of the sprint
Document any major decisions or changes made during the sprint
Note lessons learned and areas for improvement
Prepare sprint report for stakeholders

subStages.name: Transition to Next Sprint
content: Identify initial backlog items for next sprint
Schedule sprint planning meeting for next sprint
Ensure team is prepared for sprint review and retrospective
Close out any sprint-specific tools or documents
